sen.j: まれびと、マレビト（稀人・客人）は、時を定めて他界から来訪する霊的もしくは神的存在を指す折口学の用語。
sen.e: Marebito is a term in Orikuchiism that refers to a spiritual or deity-like being who visits from the afterworld at a specified time.

sen.j: 来訪神のまれびとは神を迎える祭などの際に、立てられた柱状の物体（髯籠・山車など）の依り代に降臨するとされた。
sen.e: At events such as festivals in which deities are welcomed, marebito, who is a visiting deity, is considered to descend on a pole-shaped object (such as a higeko (beard-box) or a dashi (a float)) that is set up as a yorishiro (object representing a divine spirit).

sen.j: 後に山岳信仰も影響し山の上・天から来る（天孫降臨）ものと移り変わったという。
sen.e: Later, with the influence of mountain worship, the belief of where marebito descends from has changed from beyond the sea to above the mountain or heavens (tensonkorin (the descent to earth of the grandson of the sun goddess)).
